\v0\par
By Council Members Salamanca and Adams\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li-5\qj\tx720\b0\tab WHEREAS, the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development, pursuant to Section 505 of Article 15 of the General Municipal Law of New York State and Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, for the Fourth Amendment to the Melrose Commons Urban Renewal Plan (the \ldblquote Plan\rdblquote ), which in conjunction with the related action would remove a 45-foot height restriction from Urban Renewal Site 15 (the \ldblquote Project Area\rdblquote ) to facilitate the development of a seven-story mixed-use building containing 20 residential units and commercial and community facility space in the Melrose neighborhood of the Bronx, Community District 1, (ULURP No. C 190039 HUK) (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tab WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on June 14, 2019 its decision and report dated June 3, 2019 (the "Decision"), on the Application;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\tab WHEREAS, the Application is related to application C 190293 HAX (L.U. No. 468), an Urban Development Action Area Project (UDAAP) designation, project approval and disposition of City-owned property to a developer to be selected by HPD; \par
 \f1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx720\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\f0 WHEREAS, the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development submitted to the Council on June 17, 2019 its request for approval of the Plan;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928       \tab WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission has certified that the Plan for the Area is an appropriate plan for the Area and conforms to the provisions of Section 502(7), Article 15 of the General Municipal Law and the finding set forth in Section 504, Article 15 of the General Municipal Law, and conforms to the comprehensive community plan for the development of the municipality as a whole;\par
\par
\tab WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission has certified its unqualified approval of the Plan pursuant to Section 505(2), Article 15 of the General Municipal Law;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928       \tab WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx810\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928       \tab WHEREAS, the Plan is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 505 of the General Municipal Law;\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928       \tab WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and the Plan on June 20, 2019;\par
\par
      \tab WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and financial implications and other policy issues relating to the Decision and the Plan; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tab WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the negative declaration issued on February 20, 2019 (CEQR No. \cf1 19HPD016X\cf0 ) (the \ldblquote Negative Declaration\rdblquote ).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1260\tx1440\tx1620\tab The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant impact on the  environment as set forth in the Negative Declaration.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\tab The Council finds that the Area is a substandard or insanitary area, or is in danger of becoming a substandard or insanitary area, and tends to impair or arrest the sound growth and development of the municipality. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\par
The Council finds that the financial aid to be provided to the municipality is necessary to enable the project to be undertaken in accordance with the Plan.\par
\par
The Council finds that the Plan affords maximum opportunity to private enterprise, consistent with the sound needs of the municipality as a whole, for the undertaking of an urban renewal program.   \par
\par
The Council finds that the Plan conforms to a comprehensive community plan for the development of the municipality as a whole.\par
\par
The Council finds that there is a feasible method for the relocation of families and individuals displaced from the Area into decent, safe and sanitary dwellings, which are or will be provided in the Area or in other areas not generally less desirable in regard to public utilities and public and commercial facilities, at rents or prices within the financial means of such families or individuals, and reasonably accessible to their places of employment. \par
\par
The Council finds that the undertaking and carrying out of the urban renewal activities in stages is in the best public interest and will not cause an additional or increased hardship, to the residents of the Area.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\tab The Council finds that the proposed Fourth Amended Melrose Commons Urban Renewal Plan is an appropriate plan for the area involved, complies with provisions of Article 15 of the General Municipal Law and conforms to the comprehensive community plan for the development of the municipality as a whole and is consistent with local objectives.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tab Pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 190292 HUX, incorporated by reference herein, and the record before the Council, the Council approves the Decision.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj The Council approves the designation of the Area pursuant to Section 504 of the General Municipal Law.\par
\par
The Council approves the amendment of the Plan pursuant to Section 505 of the General Municipal Law and Section 197-d of the Charter.  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 Adopted.\par
